column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat|salience|identity|centering
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent

#Summary1=(human1) On a slow carriage ride with Death and Immortality, the narrator passes by the school, the fields of grain and the setting sun, then pauses before a house that seemed a swelling of the ground, where centuries later it feels shorter than the day the narrator realized the horses' heads were toward eternity.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) Death kindly picks up the narrator in his carriage for a leisurely journey passing through scenes of life (children at school, fields of grain, and the setting sun) until they reach a grave, marking the beginning of an eternal journey that feels shorter than that first day.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) In this poem, the narrator describes their journey with the personified figure of Death in a carriage accompanied by Immortality, observing life's stages and concluding at a grave-like destination, reflecting on the eternal nature of the journey since realizing the finality of death.
#Summary4=(Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct) Death kindly stops for the speaker, who embarks on a slow and peaceful journey with Immortality to eternity with no hurry or sense of urgency.
#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-3B-Instruct) The poem describes a serene encounter with Death as a carriage ride through scenes of nature, ending with a realization of eternity beyond human time.
#Text=Because I could not stop for Death — He kindly stopped for me —
#Text=The Carriage held but just Ourselves — And Immortality .
#Text=We slowly drove —
#Text=He knew no haste ,
#Text=And I had put away My labor and my leisure too , For His Civility —
#Text=We passed the School , where Children strove At recess — in the ring —
#Text=We passed the Fields of Gazing Grain —
#Text=We passed the Setting Sun —
#Text=Or rather — He passed Us —
#Text=The Dews drew quivering and chill —
#Text=For only Gossamer , my Gown — My Tippet — only Tulle —
#Text=We paused before a House that seemed A Swelling of the Ground —
#Text=The Roof was scarcely visible —
#Text=The Cornice — in the Ground —
#Text=Since then — 't is centuries — and yet Feels shorter than the Day I first surmised the Horses ' Heads Were toward Eternity —
